MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function AreSamePhoneNumber (number1 As String, number2 As String, defaultCountryIso As String) As Boolean
public: static bool AreSamePhoneNumber(System::String ^ number1, System::String ^ number2, System::String ^ defaultCountryIso);
public static bool AreSamePhoneNumber (string number1, string number2, string defaultCountryIso);
.method public static hidebysig bool AreSamePhoneNumber(string number1, string number2, string defaultCountryIso) cil managed
static member AreSamePhoneNumber : string * string * string -> bool

Docs.param: The lowercase two letter ISO 3166-1 country code. Used when parsing the phone numbers where it is not possible to determine the country associated with a phone number based on the number alone. It is recommended to pass in TelephonyManager#getNetworkCountryIso().
Docs.summary: Determines if two phone numbers are the same.
Docs.returns: True if the two given phone number are same.

remarks.para: Determines if two phone numbers are the same.

Matching is based on libphonenumber. Unlike #compare(String, String), matching takes into account national dialing plans rather than simply matching the last 7 digits of the two phone numbers. As a result, it is expected that some numbers which would match using the previous method will no longer match using this new approach.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public static hidebysig string ConvertKeypadLettersToDigits(string input) cil managed
static member ConvertKeypadLettersToDigits : string -> string

Docs.summary: Translates any alphabetic letters (i.
Docs.returns: the input string, with alpha letters converted to numeric digits using the phone keypad letter mapping. For example, an input of "1-800-GOOG-411" will return "1-800-4664-411".

remarks.para: Translates any alphabetic letters (i.e. [A-Za-z]) in the specified phone number into the equivalent numeric digits, according to the phone keypad letter mapping described in ITU E.161 and ISO/IEC 9995-8.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared Function ExtractNetworkPortion (phoneNumber As String) As String
public: static System::String ^ ExtractNetworkPortion(System::String ^ phoneNumber);
public static string? ExtractNetworkPortion (string? phoneNumber);
.method public static hidebysig string ExtractNetworkPortion(string phoneNumber) cil managed
static member ExtractNetworkPortion : string -> string

Docs.summary: Extracts the network address portion and canonicalizes (filters out separators.

remarks.para: Extracts the network address portion and canonicalizes (filters out separators.) Network address portion is everything up to DTMF control digit separators (pause or wait), but without non-dialable characters.
Please note that the GSM wild character is allowed in the result. This must be resolved before dialing.
Returns null if phoneNumber == null
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Extracts the post-dial sequence of DTMF control digits, pauses, and waits.

remarks.para: Extracts the post-dial sequence of DTMF control digits, pauses, and waits. Strips separators. This string may be empty, but will not be null unless phoneNumber == null.
Returns null if phoneNumber == null

remarks.para: Checks a given number against the list of emergency numbers provided by the RIL and SIM card.

Docs.summary: isVoiceMailNumber: checks a given number against the voicemail number provided by the RIL and SIM card.
Docs.returns: true if the number is in the list of voicemail. False otherwise, including if the caller does not have the permission to read the VM number.

remarks.para: isVoiceMailNumber: checks a given number against the voicemail number provided by the RIL and SIM card. The caller must have the READ_PHONE_STATE credential.

Docs.summary: Returns the rightmost minimum matched characters in the network portion in *reversed* order

remarks.para: Returns the rightmost minimum matched characters in the network portion in *reversed* order
This can be used to do a database lookup against the column that stores getStrippedReversed()
Returns null if phoneNumber == null
